title: Printed Ornaments
content:
Besides on wine bottles I've seen ornaments like this in a book from about the middle of the 16th century. Could somebody put me into the right direction to find more information about them? Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070435im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bianco_6064.jpg)
author: tina

comments.content:
These particular forms are often referred to as Granjon ornaments or Granjon fleurons, I believe.

You'll find some digital versions in this collection:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/arabesque-ornaments-two-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070435/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/arabesque-ornaments-two-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/arabesque-ornaments-two-mt/")

The early 20th-century designer & typographer Bruce Rogers was fond of using them to great effect.

If you search on some of those terms, you may find some info.

-- K.

Tina,

I think you may have an easier time matching this work with this font.

[http://www.p22.com/Lanston/Giampa/Granjon.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070435/http:/www.p22.com/Lanston/Giampa/Granjon.html "http://www.p22.com/Lanston/Giampa/Granjon.html")

Giampa

WOW, this is gorgeous!  
Thank you very much!
